info.name: dream
info.description:
# Introduction
What does your API do?

# Overview
Things that the developers should know about

# Authentication
What is the preferred way of using the API?

# Error Codes
What errors and status codes can a user expect?

# Rate limit
Is there a limit to the number of requests an user can send?

            "title": "A educação matemática: Wanderson Silva at TEDxECC",
            "description": "No TEDxECC, Wanderson Silva faz uma empolgante apresentação sobre o ensino da matemática no Brasil para alunos e professores.\n\nIn the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. At a TEDx event, TEDTalks video and live speakers combine to spark deep discussion and connection in a small group. These local, self-organized events are branded TEDx, where x = independently organized TED event. The TED Conference provides general guidance for the TEDx program, but individual TEDx events are self-organized.* (*Subject to certain rules and regulations)",

request.description:
The HTTP `GET` request method is meant to retrieve data from a server. The data
is identified by a unique URI (Uniform Resource Identifier). 

A `GET` request can pass parameters to the server using "Query String 
Parameters". For example, in the following request,

> http://example.com/hi/there?hand=wave

The parameter "hand" has the value "wave".

This endpoint echoes the HTTP headers, request parameters and the complete
URI requested.

A `GET` request can pass parameters to the server using "Query String

The parameter "hand" has the value "wave".

This endpoint echoes the HTTP headers, request parameters and the complete
URI requested.

The HTTP `GET` request method is meant to retrieve data from a server. The data
is identified by a unique URI (Uniform Resource Identifier). 

A `GET` request can pass parameters to the server using "Query String 
Parameters". For example, in the following request,

response.name: List of tasks
response.body:
{
    "current_page": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 298,
            "task_id": 2822720,
            "video_id": "0lvEBIKUmaaD",
            "language": "en",
            "type": "Review",
            "priority": 0,
            "created": "2018-08-29T19:08:06Z",
            "modified": "2018-08-29T19:08:06Z",
            "completed": null,
            "created_at": "2018-09-10 21:12:12",
            "updated_at": "2018-09-10 21:12:12",
            "primary_audio_language_code": "es",
            "original_language": "es",
            "title": "Químicos en el hogar: Una amenaza invisible | Fernando Manera | TEDxCórdoba",
            "description": "Esta charla es de un evento TEDx, organizado de manera independiente de las conferencias TED. Más información en: http://ted.com/tedx\n\nFernando es bioquímico y actualmente se desempeña como director de MicroBioLab y funcionario del área de Salud de la Municipalidad de Colonia Caroya, provincia de Córdoba. A partir de sus trabajos, se transformó en un referente obligado en cuestiones vinculadas a la salud pública y al mundo químico sintético con el que estamos en permanente interacción. Estos peligros cotidianos son detallados en su libro “Una amenaza invisible” y en otras acciones de divulgación por las cuales ha recibido reconocimientos del INAL (Instituto Nacional de Alimentos). Además, Fernando aportó datos concluyentes para que ANMAT (Administración Nacional de Medicamentos, Alimentos y Tecnología Médica) obligara a las empresas farmacéuticas a abandonar el uso del agente químico conocido como Lindano en las composiciones antipediculicidas.",
            "duration": 680,
            "thumbnail": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/s3.userdata.www.universalsubtitles.org/video/thumbnail/f2dacff310e8e5b89c19cebccad51f38f9310ed6_jpg_480x270_crop-smart_upscale-True_q85.jpg",
            "team": "ted",
            "project": "tedxtalks",
            "video_url": "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vHm0mwptQTM"
        },
        {
            "id": 1050,
            "task_id": 2809875,
            "video_id": "2hoxtBGCQnSH",
            "language": "en",
            "type": "Review",
            "priority": 0,
            "created": "2018-08-22T12:49:08Z",
            "modified": "2018-09-08T22:26:48Z",
            "completed": null,
            "created_at": "2018-09-10 21:40:12",
            "updated_at": "2018-09-10 21:40:12",
            "primary_audio_language_code": "en",
            "original_language": "en",
            "title": "A 12-year-old inventor's device for detecting lead in water | Gitanjali Rao | TEDxNashville",
            "description": "After seventh grader Gitanjali Rao heard about the Flint water crisis, she wanted to do something to help, After much research, she created \"Tethys\" -- a device that can detect lead in drinking water.\n\nIn 2018, she was named \"America's top young scientist\" for her design.\n\nThis talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx",
            "duration": 694,
            "thumbnail": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/s3.userdata.www.universalsubtitles.org/video/thumbnail/f4b698bc06730ac79a3d429d24fe69e05e593592_480x270_crop-smart_upscale-True_q85.jpg",
            "team": "ted",
            "project": "tedxtalks",
            "video_url": "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gVgaJN3GI6U"
        },
        {
            "id": 653,
            "task_id": 2823830,
            "video_id": "2nd2WYEDXSHz",
            "language": "en",
            "type": "Review",
            "priority": 0,
            "created": "2018-08-30T20:40:28Z",
            "modified": "2018-08-30T20:40:28Z",
            "completed": null,
            "created_at": "2018-09-10 21:24:11",
            "updated_at": "2018-09-10 21:24:11",
            "primary_audio_language_code": "en",
            "original_language": "en",
            "title": "How today’s veterans build community differently | Noah Siple | TEDxBoise",
            "description": "U. S. Army National Guard Major Noah Siple challenges the social narrative around military veterans with his portrayal of the emerging generation of all-volunteer, post-9/11 veterans and how they choose to build communities differently. With a message applicable for leaders of all types of communities working to engage the younger generation, Noah offers concrete ways to attract young people and inspire meaningful social activism.\n\nNoah is a combat veteran and recipient of the Bronze Star and Combat Action Badge. Living his message that a veteran's desire to volunteer doesn't end with military service, he works to create spaces for veterans by building communities around group affinity, and disrupting stereotypes about what today’s warriors really seek in order to feel part of their community. Noah Siple has a passion for enriching the lives of veterans through employment, education, purpose, and social connection. He advocates for building community in ways that meet the needs of emerging generations of veterans in Idaho. Noah is a combat veteran and recipient of the Bronze Star and the Combat Action Badge. He is an Army strategist, and currently the Chief Operations Officer of the 116th Cavalry Brigade Combat Team, as a Major in the Idaho Army National Guard. Noah has served in the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and Europe. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx",
            "duration": 862,
            "thumbnail": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/s3.userdata.www.universalsubtitles.org/video/thumbnail/c7995391fea9b93e15a2b132d207d1d33252e843_480x270_crop-smart_upscale-True_q85.jpg",
            "team": "ted",
            "project": "tedxtalks",
            "video_url": "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lnZd9JKHmW8"
        },
        {
            "id": 469,
            "task_id": 2826977,
            "video_id": "2rNlDKJctTvy",
            "language": "en",
            "type": "Review",
            "priority": 0,
            "created": "2018-09-03T20:34:25Z",
            "modified": "2018-09-03T20:34:25Z",
            "completed": null,
            "created_at": "2018-09-10 21:19:04",
            "updated_at": "2018-09-10 21:19:04",
            "primary_audio_language_code": "de",
            "original_language": "de",
            "title": "Die eingerahmte Wirklichkeit | Stephan Bruckmeier | TEDxStuttgart",
            "description": "Stephan Bruckmeier lädt das Publikum zu einem Fußballspiel auf die Bühne – der Auftakt zu einer Tour de Force, während der er unsere Res\u00adsen\u00adti\u00adments für \"Andere\" beleuchtet.\n\nStephan Bruckmeier wurde 1962 in Wien geboren und lebt seit über 20 Jahren in Deutschland. Er realisierte weit über einhundert Theaterprojekte in Deutschland, Frankreich, Kenia, Mosambik, den Niederlanden, Österreich, Ungarn und den USA. Er wurde mit dem Josef Kainz Preis Wien, dem Karl Skraup Preis Wien, dem Kölner Theaterpreis, dem Baden-Württembergischen Jugendtheaterpreis und der Stuttgarter Ehrenmünze ausgezeichnet. Von 1998 bis 2008 war er im Leitungsteam des Theater Rampe Stuttgart, von 2000 bis 2004 Intendant des NÖ.Donaufestivals. 2006 eröffnete er den Stuttgarter Fernsehturm als Theaterspielort. Er ist regelmäßiger Gast bei den Stuttgarter Schauspielbühnen, dem Altonaer Theater Hamburg und den Burgfestspielen Jagsthausen. Seit 2003 arbeitet er in Afrika, 2009 gründete er das Hope Theater Nairobi mit regelmäßigen Gastspielen in Deutschland. Seit 2011 lebt er auch in Nairobi und beschäftigt sich intensiv mit der schwierigen Beziehung zwischen den Kontinenten Afrika und Europa.\n\nDieser Vortrag wurde bei einem TEDx-Event gehalten, der dem Format für TED-Konferenzen entspricht, aber eigenständig von einem lokalen Veranstalter organisiert wurde. Erfahren Sie mehr unter http://ted.com/tedx.",
            "duration": 996,
            "thumbnail": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/s3.userdata.www.universalsubtitles.org/video/thumbnail/1812e0f6d25dcac1e443bb7dfa963b49d6b6d7c7_jpg_480x270_crop-smart_upscale-True_q85.jpg",
            "team": "ted",
            "project": "tedxtalks",
            "video_url": "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJ7EySRbVBs"
        },
        {
            "id": 1513,
            "task_id": 2794273,
            "video_id": "3WFWEpo0F1Da",
            "language": "en",
            "type": "Review",
            "priority": 0,
            "created": "2018-08-07T09:06:44Z",
            "modified": "2018-08-07T09:06:44Z",
            "completed": null,
            "created_at": "2018-09-10 22:03:47",
            "updated_at": "2018-09-10 22:03:47",
            "primary_audio_language_code": "es",
            "original_language": "es",
            "title": "La felicidad se puede imprimir | Guillermo Martínez | TEDxManzanares",
            "description": "Esta charla es de un evento TEDx, organizado de manera independiente de las conferencias TED. Más información en: http://ted.com/tedx\n\n¿Cómo un ingeniero en organización industrial madrileño puede acabar dando una segunda oportunidad a personas del otro lado del mundo? Después de acabar su carrera de ingeniería, frustrado de tanto estudiar y poco poner en práctica, Guillermo Martínez decidió realizar un voluntariado en Kenia donde una impresora 3D le ayudó a cambiar vidas. Nos contará su historia, y es que la felicidad, se puede imprimir.\n\nGuillermo es graduado en Ingeniería en Organización Industrial y especializado en diseño de drones y fabricación aditiva.  Su proyecto Ayúdame3D nació tras un viaje de voluntariado a Kenia, ofreciendo gratuitamente prótesis 3D de brazos a personas del Valle del Rift. Ha diseñado varias prótesis que llevó a África, mejorando la vida de los campesinos del poblado de Kabarnet, en el suroeste de Kenia.",
            "duration": 711,
            "thumbnail": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/s3.userdata.www.universalsubtitles.org/video/thumbnail/31c2ee15a5940b9c2069f283ba4388e9045c3055_480x270_crop-smart_upscale-True_q85.jpg",
            "team": "ted",
            "project": "tedxtalks",
            "video_url": "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KiOYhgq9xvE"
        },
        {
            "id": 445,
            "task_id": 2827865,
            "video_id": "3Wn6G4Y9qWjJ",
            "language": "en",
            "type": "Review",
            "priority": 0,
            "created": "2018-09-04T08:39:17Z",
            "modified": "2018-09-04T08:39:17Z",
            "completed": null,
            "created_at": "2018-09-10 21:18:03",
            "updated_at": "2018-09-10 21:18:03",
            "primary_audio_language_code": "en",
            "original_language": "en",
            "title": "Breaking free: freedom, peace and prosperity | Dirk Helbing | TEDxVarese",
            "description": "What has happened to our dream of a society in which we can all live in freedom, equality and solidarity? How have technology and economy affected this great dream? Dirk Helbing, a professor of Computational Social Science at ETH Zurich, chair of Future ICT steering committee, affiliate professor at TU Delft, external faculty of the Complexity Science Hub Vienna, explains to us how we get here and proposes a solution to restore the feasibility of our dream. The notion of democratic capitalism and the right use of information and technology can be the keys to helping everyone break free.\n\nCosa è successo al nostro sogno di una società in cui tutti possiamo vivere in libertà, uguaglianza e solidarietà? In che modo la tecnologia e l'economia hanno influenzato questo grande sogno? Dirk Helbing, professore di Scienze sociali computazionali presso l'ETH di Zurigo, presidente del comitato direttivo Future ICT, professore associato presso TU Delft, facoltà esterna del Complexity Science Hub Vienna, ci spiega come siamo arrivati a questo punto e propone una soluzione per ripristinare la fattibilità del nostro sogno. La nozione di capitalismo democratico e il corretto uso delle informazioni e della tecnologia possono essere le chiavi per aiutare tutti a liberarsi. Dirk Helbing è professore ordinario e direttore dell’Istituto per i trasporti e l’economia all’Università di tecnologia di Dresda. Dal giugno 2015 è membro della Facoltà di Tecnologia, Politica e Management di TU Delft, dove dirige la scuola di dottorato in “Ingegneria delle tecnologie sociali per un futuro digitale responsabile”. È stato anche co-fondatore della divisione Physics of Socio-Economic Systems della German Physical Society (DPG). Ha co-fondato il Centro di competenza per complessi sistemi socio-economici, il Centro rischi, l’Istituto per la scienza, la tecnologia e la politica (ISTP) e il Decision Science Laboratory (DeSciL). È membro dei consigli di amministrazione del Global Brain Institute di Bruxelles e dell’International Center for Earth Simulation di Ginevra. È anche coinvolto nelle attività di “Staatslabor” (un’iniziativa scientifica del governo svizzero), nonché nella creazione dell’iniziativa Blockchain [X] e del Blockchain Lab a Delft. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx",

            "title": "Old Art, Fresh Design | Julia Noulin-Merat | TEDxUNO",
            "description": "Mozart set in a nightclub? Opera in a warehouse? TEDxUNO speaker Julia Noulin-Mérat is changing the way we think of opera by bringing this classic art form into the 21st century. \r\n\n\nA triple American, Canadian and French citizen, Julia Noulin-Mérat is the principal designer at Noulin-Mérat Studio, an intrepid NYC production design firm that specializes in Theater, Film & TV, with an emphasis in Opera and immersive site specific theatre. In addition to her work as Associate Producer for Boston Lyric Opera, Ms. Noulin-Mérat is Director of Design and Production for Guerilla Opera and resident set designer for Attic Theater in New York. \r\n\r\nLast season, Ms. Noulin-Mérat earned ArtsImpulse’s Award Best Boston Set Design for her production of The Rape of Lucretia and Best Opera for Gallo. The 2016-17 Season started with her designing La Traviata for Pittsburgh Opera and Peter Pan in a 50,000 feet immersive show in Beijing. Ms. Noulin-Mérat returns to Opera Omaha in February to design Mozart’s Così fan tutte before heading back to Boston Lyric Opera for Stravinsky’s The Rake’s Progress.\n\nThis talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at http://ted.com/tedx",

            "title": "The virtues of gossip: Richard Weiner at TEDxMiami 2013",
            "description": "Richard Weiner is the author of 23 books, including Webster's New World Dictionary of Media and Communications, found in major libraries around the world, and Professional's Guide to Public Relations Services, a textbook at many colleges.\n\nIn the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience.             "title": "Trovare un equilibrio tra cambiamento e tradizione | Federico Visconti | TEDxVarese",
            "description": "Qual è il contributo dell’Università nel trovare un nuovo punto di equilibrio nei modelli educativi tra ciò che cambia per effetto della tecnologia e ciò che permane in virtù della natura umana? Federico Visconti, Rettore della LIUC - Università Cattaneo e professore ordinario di Economia Aziendale presso la medesima università, traccia una possibile risposta a questa domanda sottolineando l’importanza di affiancare alla dimensione del “lifelong learning” quella del “long-lasting learning”.\n\nQuesto intervento è stato presentato a un evento TEDx, che utilizza il format della conferenza TED ma è stato organizzato in maniera indipendente da una comunità locale.\n\nPer maggiori informazioni, visita il sito http://ted.com/tedx",

            "title": "How art and science collaborate, intervene and innovate | Claudia Schnugg | TEDxLinz",
            "description": "Have you ever thought of combining two remarkably different fields like art and science?  What happens when artists start using new technologies and scientific research as their tools? Can breaking the routines and challenging the organisational structures with artistic interventions improve the research process? Different career goals of artists and scientists can help to understand the value of one’s work from a perspective of an uncommon audience. Expand your normal thinking and find a better solution. Claudia Schnugg is a researcher and ArtScience consultant whose passion is to connect art, science, technology and business. Now she is on the stage to tell about the projects she has investigated and worked with. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx",

            "title": "Tiny House, une maison alternative connectée au monde | Yvan SAINT-JOURS | TEDxClermont",
            "description": "Alors éditeur d’un magazine écologiste, Yvan habitait une maison certes écologique, mais grande. Grande en tout cas pour l’un des nombreux visiteurs qu’il avait accueilli. La graine était semée… Et c’est quelques années plus tard qu’il se décidera à construire la première Tiny House en France.\n\nYvan a fondé deux magazines : La Maison Écologique et le magazine de société Kaizen. Yvan est actuellement auteur et directeur de collection aux éditions YpyPyp spécialisées sur les questions d’autonomie (habitat, permaculture, alimentation...). Il vit en Auvergne, dans les Combrailles, dans sa tiny auto-construite en 2013. Pionnier dans ce domaine, il a écrit l’ouvrage « Tiny House, le nid qui voyage » .\n\nCette présentation a été donnée lors d'un événement TEDx local utilisant le format des conférences TED mais organisé indépendamment. En savoir plus : http://ted.com/tedx",

            "title": "Closing Closets: The Upside of Disclosing Your Sexual Identity | Jeroen Mulder | TEDxTwenteU",
            "description": "'Coming out of the closet' is the term we use when we talk about disclosing your sexual identity, a metaphor that has gained a greatly negative connotation over the years. Based on his personal experience, Jeroen makes a case for using the metaphor of an inspiring journey, focusing on the joys and upside of disclosing your sexual orientation, instead of on the downside of the claustrophobic closet.\n\nJeroen Mulder is a student in communication sciences at the University of Twente. Next to that, he is engaged in Contramime, in which he entertains people with cabaret together with his fellow students.\n\nThis talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community.             "title": "Dependencia emocional | Arun Mansukhani | TEDxMalagueta",
            "description": "Esta charla es de un evento TEDx, organizado de manera independiente de las conferencias TED. Más información en: http://ted.com/tedx\n\n¿Es negativo siempre ser dependiente emocional? En esta sorprendente y divertida charla en la que todos nos sentiremos identificados, Arun nos enseña a detectar las personalidades con las que podemos entablar una sana relación de codependencia. Arun es psicólogo clínico (PsyD). Máster en Psicología Clínica. Master en Sexología. Experto Universitario en Hipnósis Clínica. EuroPsy Specialist in Psychology y Psychotherapy. Miembro de la junta directiva de la Federación Española de Sociedades Sexológicas (FESS). Presidente de la Comisión de Adopciones Internacionales del COP-AO. Asesor ante el ORAS-CONHU (Fondo de Poblaciones de Naciones Unidas).",

            "title": "Life with Gender Dysphoria | Sunny Miller | TEDxEBS",
            "description": "Imagine suffering from gender dysphoria. What would your life be like? How would society view you? How will people behave towards you? Your friends? Your family? Take a personal journey with Sunny and discover the “Turning Point” and understand the impact our society has and how we can make it a place for everyone. Sunny Miller is a kindergarten teacher, that has suffered from gender dysphoria . He discussed his personal journey and how the society might need to change their behavior to people that are or have been in his situation. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx",

            "description": "Charles will introduce us to parkour training; a form of fitness and dexterity training that employs natural (yet under-utilized) movements to effectively navigate the environment.
